title: Bug 7734 - System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a user is working on a WSWB session with opened, dirty .txt file(s), shutting down Windows without saving the changes causes the loss of the unsaved changes in the .txt file(s). No warning or question message box is displayed to give users a chance to save their changes.
EB: The system should display a warning or confirmation message box when the user attempts to shut down or restart the computer, while there are opened, dirty .txt file(s) in the WSWB session. The message box should inform users about the unsaved changes and give them an option to save the changes before proceeding with the shutdown or restart.
SR:
1. Start the WSWB application.
2. Create a new project.
3. Create a text file in the project.
4. Add some text to the text file.
5. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
6. Click on the Windows Start menu.
7. Select the 'Shut Down...' command or 'Restart...' command to shut down or restart the computer.
8. Observe that there is no warning or question message box displayed.

Expected Results: A warning or confirmation message box should be displayed, informing the user about the unsaved changes in the dirty model(s) and giving them an option to save the changes before proceeding with the shutdown or restart.
